001package com.technototes.path.subsystem;
002
003import static com.technototes.path.subsystem.DeadWheelConstants.*;
004
005import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
006import com.acmerobotics.roadrunner.geometry.Pose2d;
007import com.acmerobotics.roadrunner.localization.ThreeTrackingWheelLocalizer;
008import com.technototes.library.hardware.sensor.encoder.MotorEncoder;
009import com.technototes.library.subsystem.Subsystem;
010import java.util.Arrays;
011import java.util.List;
012
013/*
014 * Sample tracking wheel localizer implementation assuming the standard configuration:
015 *
016 *    /--------------\
017 *    |     ____     |
018 *    |     ----     |
019 *    | ||        || |
020 *    | ||        || |
021 *    |              |
022 *    |              |
023 *    \--------------/
024 *
025 */
026public class ThreeDeadWheelLocalizer extends ThreeTrackingWheelLocalizer implements Subsystem {
027
028    protected MotorEncoder leftEncoder, rightEncoder, frontEncoder;
029    protected double lateralDistance, forwardOffset, gearRatio, wheelRadius, ticksPerRev;
030
031    protected boolean encoderOverflow;
032
033    public ThreeDeadWheelLocalizer(
034        MotorEncoder l,
035        MotorEncoder r,
036        MotorEncoder f,
037        DeadWheelConstants constants
038    ) {
039        super(
040            Arrays.asList(
041                new Pose2d(0, constants.getDouble(LateralDistance.class) / 2, 0), // left
042                new Pose2d(0, -constants.getDouble(LateralDistance.class) / 2, 0), // right
043                new Pose2d(constants.getDouble(ForwardOffset.class), 0, Math.toRadians(90)) // front
044            )
045        );
046        leftEncoder = l;
047        rightEncoder = r;
048        frontEncoder = f;
049
050        lateralDistance = constants.getDouble(LateralDistance.class);
051        forwardOffset = constants.getDouble(ForwardOffset.class);
052        encoderOverflow = constants.getBoolean(EncoderOverflow.class);
053        gearRatio = constants.getDouble(GearRatio.class);
054        ticksPerRev = constants.getDouble(TicksPerRev.class);
055        wheelRadius = constants.getDouble(WheelRadius.class);
056    }
057
058    public double encoderTicksToInches(double ticks) {
059        return (getWheelRadius() * 2 * Math.PI * getGearRatio() * ticks / getTicksPerRev());
060    }
061
062    @NonNull
063    @Override
064    public List<Double> getWheelPositions() {
065        return Arrays.asList(
066            encoderTicksToInches(leftEncoder.getCurrentPosition()),
067            encoderTicksToInches(rightEncoder.getCurrentPosition()),
068            encoderTicksToInches(frontEncoder.getCurrentPosition())
069        );
070    }
071
072    @NonNull
073    @Override
074    public List<Double> getWheelVelocities() {
075        // TODO: If your encoder velocity can exceed 32767 counts / second (such as the REV Through Bore and other
076        //  competing magnetic encoders), change Encoder.getRawVelocity() to Encoder.getCorrectedVelocity() to enable a
077        //  compensation method
078
079        return Arrays.asList(
080            encoderTicksToInches(leftEncoder.getCorrectedVelocity()),
081            encoderTicksToInches(rightEncoder.getCorrectedVelocity()),
082            encoderTicksToInches(frontEncoder.getCorrectedVelocity())
083        );
084    }
085
086    public double getTicksPerRev() {
087        return ticksPerRev;
088    }
089
090    public double getWheelRadius() {
091        return wheelRadius;
092    }
093
094    public double getGearRatio() {
095        return gearRatio;
096    }
097}
